skill.name: Accessibility Auditor
skill.description: Web accessibility specialist for WCAG compliance, ARIA implementation, and inclusive design. Use when auditing websites for accessibility issues, implementing WCAG 2.1 AA/AAA standards, testing with screen readers, or ensuring ADA compliance. Expert in semantic HTML, keyboard navigation, and assistive technology compatibility.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable access detected. Contains only guidance on web accessibility best practices.

content.user_title: Audit and fix web accessibility issues
content.value_statement: Web accessibility issues can exclude users with disabilities from accessing your website. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for implementing WCAG 2.1 standards, ARIA attributes, and keyboard navigation to create inclusive experiences for all users.
actual_capabilities: Implement WCAG 2.1 Level AA and AAA standards
Add proper ARIA landmarks and attributes to web pages
Fix common accessibility issues like missing alt text and low contrast
Create keyboard-navigable interfaces and focus management
Test websites with screen readers (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)
Write semantic HTML with proper heading hierarchies and landmarks
limitations: Does not automatically scan or fix code - provides guidance only
Cannot test websites directly - requires manual testing or external tools
Does not generate accessibility statements or legal compliance documents
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines for automated testing

use_cases.title: Build Accessible Components
use_cases.description: Create accessible modals, accordions, tabs, and forms with proper ARIA attributes and focus management.

use_cases.title: Audit Web Accessibility
use_cases.description: Review websites for WCAG violations using the included testing checklist and accessibility guidelines.

use_cases.title: Design Inclusive Interfaces
use_cases.description: Design user experiences that work with assistive technologies and meet accessibility standards.

prompt_templates.title: Basic WCAG Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this HTML code for WCAG 2.1 AA compliance. Check for missing alt text, color contrast issues, and semantic HTML problems.

prompt_templates.title: ARIA Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me add proper ARIA attributes to make this custom component accessible. It is a [dropdown/modal/accordion] component.

prompt_templates.title: Keyboard Navigation
prompt_templates.prompt: This component is not keyboard accessible. Show me how to implement proper tab order and keyboard event handling.

prompt_templates.title: Screen Reader Test
prompt_templates.prompt: What screen reader tests should I run to verify this page is accessible for users with visual impairments?

output: Use <nav> element with aria-label to identify the navigation region
Ensure all links are focusable with proper tabindex values
Add keyboard navigation with arrow keys for dropdown menus
Include a skip link to bypass repetitive navigation
Verify focus indicator is visible on all interactive elements

best_practices: Start accessibility testing early in development rather than fixing issues at the end
Use semantic HTML elements before adding ARIA attributes
Test with real assistive technologies, not just automated tools
Include users with disabilities in your testing process when possible
anti_patterns: Using role="button" on div elements without proper keyboard support
Relying on placeholder text as a substitute for visible form labels
Using color alone to convey information
Disabling focus indicators with CSS outline: none without providing alternatives

faq.question: What WCAG levels does this skill cover?
faq.answer: The skill covers WCAG 2.1 Level AA requirements as the baseline, with additional guidance for Level AAA enhanced requirements.

faq.question: What is the minimum color contrast ratio?
faq.answer: Normal text requires 4.5:1 ratio for AA compliance and 7:1 for AAA. Large text (18px+) needs 3:1 for AA and 4.5:1 for AAA.

faq.question: Does this skill work with React or Vue?
faq.answer: Yes. The accessibility principles and ARIA patterns apply to any web framework. The code examples are framework-agnostic HTML.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. No data is stored, transmitted, or accessed outside the conversation.

faq.question: Why is my accessibility audit failing?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing alt text on images, low color contrast, unlabeled form fields, missing landmarks, and lack of keyboard navigation support.

faq.question: How is this different from automated accessibility tools?
faq.answer: Automated tools catch about 30% of issues. This skill provides human expertise for complex scenarios like custom components, focus management, and screen reader compatibility.
